_comment: Created by ianb on 04/11/2014 12:54:07 using v2.2
title: Do inpatients feel they were given enough information about their treatment or condition?
analysis_commentary: The majority of inpatients reported that they were given enough information about their treatment or condition in all years and was 80% in 2013. The proportion of inpatients who didn't feel they had enough information about their treatment or condition has varied little over time, being between 20% and 22% in all years. â€“ a value that appears to have remained stubbornly consistent despite all the changes in healthcare over the decade. The proportion of inpatients reporting they had too much information has been low at 1% in all years.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Survey of Adult Inpatients and Survey of Outpatients
